mazes
Class AliceState

java.lang.Object
  environment.AbstractState
      mazes.MazeState
          mazes.AliceState
All Implemented Interfaces:
IState, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AliceDistanceState
public class AliceState
extends MazeState

A view on a maze, as it can be perceived by a mobile robot, like Alice :

  • Its coordinates x,y (for the supervisor LabAlice, but not used by the state itself)
  • What it sees in the 4 orthogonal directions (forward, left, backward and right)
  • Its orientation (N,E,S,W) (for the supervisor, not used by the state itself)

Author:
Francesco De Comite
See Also:
Serialized Form

whatSurroundsMe

protected int[] whatSurroundsMe
Objective view of the neighbourood : 0-> North 1->East ... The robot view of its environment will be a shift of those values

orientation

protected int orientation
Direction towards the robot looks (used by the maze supervisor, not available in state's calculations) 0-> North, 1-> East ...
